isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - TURBOCHARGERS - RECONDITIONING - CLEANING AND INSPECTION

step1.para: Prior to cleaning, visually inspect ALL the components for signs of rubbing or wear which may not be evident after cleaning.
Soak all parts in Bendix Metal Cleaner or Gunk Hydroseal to clean. DO NOT use a caustic solution.
Clean deposits using a soft brush or a plastic scraper.
Dry parts using filtered compressed air.

note.para: 1. DO NOT USE A STEEL BRUSH OR STEEL BLADE SCRAPER TO CLEAN TURBOCHARGER PARTS.
2. BE SURE ALL BLADES ARE THOROUGHLY CLEANED, AS ANY DEPOSITS LEFT ON THE BLADES WILL AFFECT BALANCE.

step1.para: Dry all internal cavities of the center housing using filtered compressed air.

Visually inspect both wheels of the rotor assembly for damaged or distorted blades and for possible contact with their respective housings. Check for cracked, bent or broken blades. Replace components if necessary.

note.para: DO NOT ATTEMPT TO STRAIGHTEN BLADES.

step1.para: Visually inspect the turbine and compressor housings for cracks and/or scoring.
Visually inspect the thrust washer and collar for wear or damage and replace as required.
Inspect the thrust spring in the back plate for wear or damage. DO NOT remove the thrust spring to inspect it. If damaged, remove and install a new thrust spring.
Visually inspect the bearing surfaces for scratches and wear. Replace bearings as necessary.
Inspect the turbine wheel shaft for scratches, scoring or pitting. Replace as required.

note.para: NEVER GRIND OR POLISH THE SHAFT; IT WILL ADVERSELY AFFECT BALANCE.

step1.para: Inspect the piston ring groove walls on the shaft for scoring. Replace as required.
Inspect for worn or scored surfaces in the center housing bearing bores.
Visually inspect the following mating surfaces for nicks or gouges:
The mating surfaces must be smooth to seal and provide proper clearances for the compressor impeller and turbine wheel. Replace any part which does not meet the inspection criteria.
